title: Aen 2 692-694 - SS sight - line 1 - Vocab - fari

content.description:
An Astonishing Act of Nature

Vix ea fatus erat seniorsenior, -is, m. = senex, senis,1 subitoque fragorefragor, -oris, m.: crash 
intonuitintono, -ere, -ui: to thunder laevumlaevum, adv.: on the left side, et de caelo lapsa per umbras 
stellastella, -ae, f.: star, facemfax, facis, f. = flamma, -ae ducens, multa cum luce cucurrit.
 1:refers to Anchises (Aeneas’s father)↩
content.question: In line 1, what does fatus erat mean?

unit.text: 6: Course Project and Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
